title-group.article-title: Primitive Central Idempotents of Finite Group Rings of Symmetric Groups

abstract.p: Let p be a prime. We denote by <tex-math>$S_n $</tex-math> the symmetric group of degree n, by <tex-math>$A_n $</tex-math> the alternating group of degree n and by <tex-math>$F_p $</tex-math> the field with p elements. An important concept of modular representation theory of a finite group G is the notion of a block. The blocks are in one-to-one correspondence with block idempotents, which are the primitive central idempotents of the group ring <tex-math>$F_q G$</tex-math>, where q is a prime power. Here, we describe a new method to compute the primitive central idempotents of <tex-math>$F_q G$</tex-math> for arbitrary prime powers q and arbitrary finite groups G. For the group rings <tex-math>$F_p S_n $</tex-math> of the symmetric group, we show how to derive the primitive central idempotents of <tex-math>$F_p S_{n - p} $</tex-math> from the idempotents of <tex-math>$F_p S_n $</tex-math>. Improving the theorem of Osima for symmetric groups we exhibit a new subalgebra of <tex-math>$F_p S_n $</tex-math> which contains the primitive central idempotents. The described results are most efficient for p = 2. In an appendix we display all primitive central idempotents of <tex-math>$F_2 S_n $</tex-math> and <tex-math>$F_4 A_n $</tex-math> for n ≤ 50 which we computed by this method.
